briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of KPI-121 Compared to Placebo in Subjects With Dry Eye Disease

armGroups.label: Vehicle of KPI-121 0.25% Ophthalmic Suspension
interventionNames: Drug: Vehicle of KPI-121 0.25% Ophthalmic Suspension

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Have a documented clinical diagnosis of dry eye disease in both eyes

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known hypersensitivity or contraindication to the investigational product(s) or components
* History of glaucoma, IOP\>21 mmHg at the screening or randomization visits, or being treated for glaucoma in either eye.
* Diagnosis of: ongoing ocular infection; severe/serious ocular condition that in judgment of Investigator could confound study assessments or limit compliance; or have been exposed to an investigational drug within 30 days prior to screening.
* In the opinion of the Investigator or study coordinator, be unwilling or unable to comply with study protocol or unable to successfully instill eye drops.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Bulbar Conjunctival Hyperemia at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean change from baseline for bulbar conjunctival hyperemia in the study eye between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-4 grading scale. The grading scale was based on the Cornea and Contact Lens Research Unit Grading Scale where 0 = none, 1 = very slight, 2 = slight, 3 = moderate and 4 = severe.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Ocular Discomfort Severity at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Subjects With ≥ 1 Unit Improvement From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Bulbar Conjunctival Hyperemia Worst Region at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of subjects with ≥1 improvement from baseline in conjunctival hyperemia scores in the study eye. The grading scale was based on the Cornea and Contact Lens Research Unit Grading Scale where 0 = none, 1 = very slight, 2 = slight, 3 = moderate and 4 = severe.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/ Visit 2 (Day 1) in Ocular Discomfort Severity Scores at Visit 3 (Day 8)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of ocular discomfort scores between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse using 3-day mean scores.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Week 2 (Day 1) in Ocular Discomfort Scores to Day 4
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Week 2 (Day 1) in Ocular Discomfort Severity at Visit 4 (Day 15) in a Subgroup
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse, in a sub-group of participants with more severe ocular discomfort at baseline, using 3 day means.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Ocular Discomfort Severity Scores at Day 3 (Diary)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort severity between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Eye Dryness Scores at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean eye dryness between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Eye Dryness Scores at Visit 3 (Day 8)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean eye dryness between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Ocular Discomfort Severity Scores on Day 2 (Diary) Minus Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Ocular Discomfort Frequency Scores at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort frequency between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Subject-rated Ocular Discomfort Frequency Scores at Visit 3 (Day 8)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean ocular discomfort frequency between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using a 0-100 visual analog grading scale where 0 was better and 100 was worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Inferior Corneal Fluorescein Staining Score at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean corneal fluorescein staining in the study eye between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using methods developed by the National Eye Institute (NEI) Dry Eye Workshop in evaluating 5 regions of the cornea (superior, inferior, nasal, temporal and central) using a 0-3 grading scale, where 0 = no visible staining, 1 = Mild, 2 = moderate and 3 = severe.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline/Visit 2 (Day 1) in Nasal Corneal Fluorescein Staining Score at Visit 4 (Day 15)
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of mean nasal corneal fluorescein staining in the study eye between the KPI-121 0.25% ophthalmic suspension group and the vehicle group using methods developed by the National Eye Institute (NEI) Dry Eye Workshop in evaluating 5 regions of the cornea (superior, inferior, nasal, temporal and central) using a 0-3 grading scale, where 0 = no visible staining, 1 = Mild, 2 = moderate and 3 = severe.
